11/05/15 11:43 AM EST
Ben Carson would like to share a drink with Jesus Christ, the Republican presidential candidate said in an interview Thursday, though it is highly unlikely that drink would be beer.
Seated across the table from Fusion host Jorge Ramos at the conclusion of a roughly 20-minute interview livestreamed on Facebook, Carson sat with a glass of orange juice.
Story Continued Below
"Who would you like to have an orange juice with or a beer with?" Ramos asked.
"Jesus," Carson responded with a chuckle.
As a Seventh-Day Adventist, it is unlikely that Carson would imbibe anything with the son of God.
“No drinking, no alcohol, no cigarette smoking or illicit drugs," Carson said in an interview with The Des Moines Register last month in discussing his faith.
Carson is the second Republican candidate in as many days to disclose with whom he would like to share a beer. During a question-and-answer session in New Hampshire on Wednesday, Florida Sen. Marco Rubio said he would choose Nobel Peace Prize winner Malala Yousafzai, though she is Muslim and not of legal drinking age (at 18 years old) in the United States, and alcohol is verboten among Muslims in her native Pakistan.
